comment.author: 30687643@N00
comment._content: The Quay, Waterford, I think it looked better then g.co/maps/2x86v

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: Another wonderful photo of my home town. The boat moored behind Hearnes is the Portlairge which was a steam dredger known by everyone as the Mudboat Built in 1907 by the Dublin Dockyard Co. she was the last working steamship in Ireland when she was retired in 1980. The Portlairge as she looks today

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Here is the Port Lairge on Streetview, not too far away.

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley/] What a shame, it should never have been allowed to leave Waterford.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: It is a great shot and the fact that it is a link in the chain of events in Waterford at that time makes it special.  I passed the Portlairge aka "The Mudboat" many times and never realised just how old it was though its lines were of a different era. The entrepreneurial expertise of Hearnes is why the name is still there today.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33577523@N08] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Thanks you two, for the Portlairge info/pictures.
